main event: A large, round, unidentified object was tracked on radar for 3-5 minutes in Fernloy, Nevada. The object appeared to hover and did not move at all, with no discernible lights or details.
interesting points: The object was tracked on radar for 3-5 minutes without any movement, appearing to be quite large and round in shape.
No lights or other details could be discerned from the object.
The report indicates that there was no explanation offered, raising the possibility of it being a weather target or possible balloon.
The document describes a bright object in the sky that changed position and direction, initially appearing as a radio tower.
An observer estimated the object to be flying at a distance of 329 to 352 miles and accelerating rapidly to a tremendous speed within 3-4 minutes.
witnesses: Unnamed military officer and observer in Fernloy, Nevada
